2  Requirements and Installation

This chapter discusses the resource and technical requirements for using the AuthorScript Advanced Data SDK, as well as test harness and bug reporting instructions. The following topics are covered:

  • Development Resources
  • System Requirements
  • Integration Requirements
  • SDK Files
  • Installation
  • Test Harness
  • Support Instructions
2.1  Development Resourcesgo:  top

The AuthorScript AD libraries are self-contained so that calls to the libraries are seamless. Sonic provides direct engineering-level assistance to AuthorScript AD developers, facilitating the integration of AuthorScript AD libraries into a third-party application.

The AuthorScript AD high-level API continues to evolve as more features of the underlying engine are exposed. If your implementation requires features that do not yet have a corresponding call in the SDK, please discuss your needs with your representative at Sonic.

2.2  System Requirementsgo:  top

A host system running AuthorScript AD must meet the following requirements in order for the API libraries to function properly:

RAM - 16MB of RAM required for code space
- 32MB required for content buffering and data
Disk Space 10 MB required for installation
2.3  Integration Requirementsgo:  top

Initial development and testing of the AuthorScript AD SDK is performed using Visual Studio .NET 2003. AuthorScript AD can be cross-compiled on various embedded platforms.

2.4  SDK Filesgo:  top

The specific makeup of a given AuthorScript AD SDK package will vary depending on license and target playback environment. In general, however, your package should include the following basic elements:

  • header files;
  • documentation (AS Imaging SDK Guide) and release notes;
  • test harness executable;
  • test harness source code;
  • libraries and dlls.

For further information about what is included in your AuthorScript AD SDK package, please contact your Sonic representative.

2.5  Installationgo:  top

Two distinct installation scenarios are covered below:

  • files installed for development environments (including upgrades);
  • files installed for end-user environments.

Development Environment Install

The AS Storage API is contained in only one DLL (AS_Storage.dll) which is called using the linking library AS_Storage.lib. This DLL is installed in the same location as the host application.

  • To install or update a newer shared driver, run pxdriver[version].exe
  • To uninstall the shared driver, use PxSetup /UNINSTALL /MIN as described in End-User Environment Install.

End-user Environment Install

AuthorScript Storage Engine components may be installed by the provided pxsetup.exe installer or by using the Microsoft Merge Modules (MSM) files.

The two merge module files, ph.msm and bl.msm, are used when installation of the Burn Engine is to be incorporated into a Microsoft Install Engine installation for the host application (the preferred installation approach). The inclusion of both files in the host application's installer package (.msi) file will enable full install, uninstall, and repair of the Burn Engine.

For non-MSI-based installs, the contents of the redist directory (minus the MSM files) should be placed on the end-user's system and PXSETUP.EXE/MIN should be executed. One of the following application error codes will be returned:

Value Definition
0 Installation was successful.
3010 Installation was successful; restart needed.
-1 Installation failed.

When the installation is completed successfully, the contents of the directory may be removed. The engine components may be unistalled with the command PXSETUP.EXE /UNINSTALL /MIN (note spaces before backslahes).

No installation mechanism is provided for the AS_Storage.dll file. It should be installed in the program directory of the host application.

NOTE: For further information on building MSI files, see http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/default.asp?url=/library/en-us/vsinstal/html/veovrusingvisualstudioinstaller.asp.

2.6  Test Harnessgo:  top

The AuthorScript AD SDK includes a command-line based test harness for testing the SDK's capabilities. The harness gives working examples of varying complexity showing the usage of AuthorScript AD funtions.

2.7  Support Instructionsgo:  top

To report any installation problems, quality issues (bugs, etc.), or feature requests to Sonic, please contact the support personnel assigned to your account.
